FuncDef:
The trap-threshold mp-lospkt-exc command sets thresholds for generating and clearing packet loss rate alarms on an MP and a global MP-group interface.
The undo trap-threshold mp-lospkt-exc command restores the default values.
By default, the thresholds for generating and clearing a packet loss rate alarm are 3E-5 and 1E-5, respectively.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a coefficient for the threshold at which a packet loss alarm is generated. The value is x in xE-y.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 9.

Sets an exponent for the threshold at which a packet loss alarm is generated. This value is y in xE-y.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 5.

Indicates the threshold for clearing a packet loss rate alarm.
The resume-threshold value must not be greater than the trigger-threshold value.

Sets a coefficient for the threshold at which a packet loss rate alarm is cleared. The value is x in xE-y.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 9.

Sets an exponent for the threshold at which a packet loss rate alarm is cleared. This value is y in xE-y.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 6.

Indicates the threshold for generating a packet loss rate alarm.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set thresholds for generating and clearing packet loss rate alarms on an MP-group and a global MP-group interface , run the trap-threshold mp-lospkt-exc command.
